String.string: You can lock open item tooltips by pressing the [Shift] key while left-clicking the item in your inventory.
You can link items into chat by holding [Ctrl] while left-clicking the item in your inventory.
You can share your location by typing /location in chat or [Ctrl] - left-clicking on the World Map.
Type /? to view the chat command help menu.
You can cycle between chat channels using the left/right arrow keys on a blank active chat line.
Scroll back through your recent outbound chat using the up/down arrow keys while in the Chat window.
You can reply to whispers by pressing the [R] key.
Press [Y] to see other players looking to form parties.
Enhancement crystals are delicate and may shatter when you die.
Standing near a campfire replenishes your Stamina and HP.
Solo players can type /invite [Joe] to apply to join Joe's party.
Type /join [Jane] to apply to join [Jane]'s party.
The Looking for Group window lets you state a goal so the whole party knows the plan.
To be tougher in a fight, attach enhancement crystals to empty slots in your armor, weapon, rings, and earrings.
Can't move your character? Click Unstuck on the System menu to teleport to the nearest town.
Skilled players and polite players are chosen for parties over others.
Type /goal to update your party's goal in the Looking for Group window.
Quests with red exclamation marks are essential to the game's storyline.
To mark a monster's location on the Map, click on its name in the quest or in your Quest Log.
Fighting Big-Ass Monsters in a party speeds your way to rewards.
Before you can teleport to a camp, you must first visit the camp yourself.
Balanced parties of a tank, a healer, and three damage dealers make short work of any opponent.
The healer in your party can summon party members together.
When multiple party members gather from one source, it yields more resources.
Up to 20 people can join a single deathmatch. Use the Activity menu to get one started!
Party members can mark monsters by using the [Q] key.
Some merchants sell crystals for armor, weapon, and accessories.
The color of a quest's name in your Quest Log indicates its difficulty for your character.
When a skill icon appears next to your crosshairs during combat, hit the space bar to instantly fire the "chained" skill.
Party Leaders can set party loot to round robin distribution for equal distribution of supplies.
Crafted equipment can be attuned for enchantment. They gain new abilities as you enchant them.
Party leaders can mark targets by hitting [Ctrl] + 1, 2, and 3.
A monster's eyes will often glint before a powerful attack.
Want to enchant equipment? Open the Activity menu and click Enchant.
Use feedstock and alkahest of the same tier to enchant an item. You can get alkahest from a shop.
When the Help button appears onscreen, press the [H] key to view a gameplay tip.
Most instanced dungeons are much easier to clear in a party.
Type /invite [character name] in the Chat window to invite a player into your party.
In UI mode, right-click players to invite them into a party, challenge them to duels, etc.
A pegasus will carry you between villages or cities...for a fee.
Every race has a few skills all its own.
Teleport scrolls are the fastest, easiest way to reach distant cities, but pricey.
Clear the screen of UI by pressing [Ctrl] + [Z] for better screenshots.
Change your shortcut keys by pressing [O] for the Options dialog.
You can create a guild through the guild manager in any major city. You have to be Level 8 or higher. Bring one other party member and {@money:3000}.
Use charms while recharging at a campfire. Others near the fire also gain the benefits.
You can send gold and items to other players through parcel post.
You can change the size and color of your chat text by right-clicking on the Chat tab.
Switch world channels via the Channel command on the System menu.
Hover your mouse over a party member's health bar to see where they are.
Your party members are highlighted on your maps even if you're on different world channels.
Your chat channel may change after using teleport scrolls, teleportals, or pegasus travel.
Remove a crystal from its socket by right-clicking on it.
Inventory Managers can expand your inventory for a fee.
Instance Matching allows party members to continue questing or crafting right up until it's time to start the dungeon.
Add quests to your onscreen Quest Tracker by checking the box by their name in your Quest Log.
Well-prepared parties collect gathering buffs and burn charms before entering dungeons.
Enchant items by clicking Enchant on the Activities menu.
A level 11 quest gives you access to a mount.
Some potions can't be purchased through merchants.
Higher-level priests and mystics can teleport party members to their side.
Press [Y] to open the Looking For Group dialog, or post from the Chat window by typing /lfg.
Apply to, check on, or praise a guild through the Guilds on Server list on your Social Menu.
Hold [Q] and left-click a monster to add a readout of its name and health to your UI.
Too busy to chat in combat? Hold [E] to choose a combat exclamation.
To rapid-fire your primary attack, just hold down the attack button.
Want to dance? Type /dance in chat.
When someone waves to you, wave back by typing /wave in chat.
Instance Matching checks for undergeared party members. You can too by typing /inspect [CharacterName].
The red door button under your compass leads you to Instance Matching with your party.
Some monsters don't come alone.
Click the middle mouse button to reset your camera angle.
Having a tank to keep the enemy's aggro makes every party member's job easier.
You can expand your Skills Tray to show more buttons with the Expand/Minimize Tray button.
You can have up to 9 different skill layouts per character. Press [Alt] and 1-9 to hot-switch between them.
Press the [BACK] button on your controller to open the Controller Configuration dialog.
Your controller's left and right bumper buttons are combo keys. Using them, every button on your controller can fire up to 4 skills.
Customize the messages on your quick-chat menu on the Game tab of your Options dialog.
Named weapons can have unique properties.
Enigmatic scrolls have a chance to create a masterwork item.
Enchantment bonuses can be changed with an Enigmatic Scroll.
Intricate enigmas may already obscure masterwork items.
Masterwork equipment can be enchanted to +12.
Dye Merchants in major cities help you change the color of your armor.
A single dye color will have different effects on differently-colored armor.
Hold Ctrl and right-click an icon to preview its appearance on your character.
When crafting, excellent work may create different items or extra materials.
Bookmark your favorite crafting recipes by clicking the star to the left of their names in the Crafting dialog.
When remodeling gear, the item you use as a visual template will be destroyed.
Weapons enchanted higher than +7 appear with a visible glow.
Guilds are an excellent way to find parties, but Looking for Group (Y) is another good way.
Joining parties lets you tackle bigger, tougher opponents and collect better gear, which lets you tackle bigger, tougher...
Auto-enter a search term in the Brokerage by [Ctrl]-left clicking an item in your inventory.
You can reset instances by typing '/reset' in chat window or using the "Reset Instances" button in your Profile (P).
Right-click the purchased recipe to obtain the craft skill.
Right-click the purchased glyph in your inventory to see it on the glyph list.
You can adjust the maximum view distance of your camera via Options.
In a large battle, maximizing the distance of your camera via Options lets you can see all the battleground in one glance.
After reaching Lv 60, pressing H will open the Vanguard Initiative quests.
Log in and complete Vanguard Initiative quests daily for rewards.
Use teleport platforms in Val Oriyn to move around faster.
In Val Oriyn, characters receive rested XP when logged out in Highwatch, any camp, or at teleport platforms.
There are teleportals in the camps of Val Oriyn. Use them to reach any camp you've already visited.
There is a teleportal from Highwatch to Velika. You will have to unlock it through the mission quests.
Sanctuarys with beneficial effects sometimes appear in Val Oriyn.
Powerful BAMs are dwelling in the lands of Val Oriyn.
The Mysterium is a large organization whose secretive leaders are mostly high elves.
Velik is quite proud of her adopted human children and the federation they helped to found.
Mysterium agents comb the world to uncover lost secrets—but for what purpose?
Popori ambushers can wait in trees for weeks, leading some enemies to wonder if they grow there like fruit.
Castanic costumes are popular for parties. Artisans make exquisite replica horns...for a price.
The whole Popori Kingdom gathers by the Lake of Tears for festivals and holidays.
Rare ores dot the hellish landscape of Fyrmount. Castanic smiths covet the metal they provide.
The amani favor big game hunting. And when they say big, they mean BIG.
Crafting and Enchanting are two skills most high elves learn early in life.
High elves have no monarchs or hereditary ruling class. Every decision is the product of subtle—and sometimes sinister—politics.
Elven families are responsible for their children's education, which includes extensive study of genealogy and ancestral history.
Through their long exile, humans have become natural explorers, adventurers, and trailblazers.
Amani fight for many reasons: for exercise, for sport, for conquest, and for survival.
Amani revere the struggles of their ancestors, long enslaved by the now-extinct empire of the giants.
Kaiator's forges and smithies are the world's most productive, serving as the engine of the Valkyon Federation's war effort.
The Scions of Lok work tirelessly to bring the long-departed god Lok back into the world. Their intrigues cover Arun like a web of shadows.
If you can't find it in Velika, it's either illegal or toxic. For those things, shop in Castanica.
The baraka are a mystery to other federation races and the focus of curiosity wherever they go.
The Mysterium studies all manner of creatures. Occasionally, there are setbacks.
Several races make up the Popori Kingdom. But their queen is always a waif-like elin.
Castanics are a matriarchal society for the most part. Males often seek their fortune elsewhere, but always have a place in the clan.
Thrill-seeking castanics are inveterate gamblers. They're also incredibly lucky.
Amani proverb: beware the food next to a popori who eats very little.
The primitive tuwangis obsess over frogs. For a tuwangi, the frog is food, pet, steed, clothing, and even building material.
Slow-cooked pigling is an amani delicacy. They roast the meat in pits—a vestige of their past as slaves when they had to hide such food from their cruel masters.
Castanic artisans meld skill and magic to create fantastic artifacts. In the past, even the gods sought castanic craftsmanship.
The magic of the elves powers a marvelous city in the middle of Shara's desert.
Humans flocked to central Arun to build the city of Velika, which rapidly became a worldwide trading hub.
The baraka are known for their love of knowledge, and also for their propensity for getting lost in a good book.
The amani sport of "huumka" has one simple rule: stay inside the circle!
Take the reins! Run for a Valkyon Federation Vanarch's office and win honor and power.
Vanarchs are regularly elected on each server. Apply to run at any major city's Election Registrar.
Some Vanarch seats are decided by popular vote, some by personal combat.
In elections, you vote for one candidate per continent through the voting icon by your Compass.
Each winning Vanarch will be assigned one province, setting policies and profiting from local taxes.
Vanarchs can make special announcements and collect taxes. The Vanarch's guild members ride special mounts.
Go to Priest Ahdun.
The expedition to the Island of Dawn is in trouble! (Prologue)
You can move by using the {W}{A}{S}{D} keys.
You can move by using ,,,
You can move by using ,,,
Press {F} to talk to Ahdun.
Press to talk to Ahdun.
Press to talk to Ahdun.
Go to Quartermaster Popomin for better gear.
New gear will show up in your Inventory {I}. Right-click {MR} to equip.
New gear will show up in your Inventory . Press , , to equip.
New gear will show up in your Inventory . Press , , to equip.
Report to Deputy Commander Akrak.
Enter the cave.
Press {SPACE} to jump.
Press to jump.
Press to jump.
Press {NUMLOCK} to run automatically.
Press to run automatically.
Press to run automatically.
Press {ALT} to switch to UI mode. In UI mode, you can use the pointer.
Press to switch to UI mode. In UI mode, you can use the pointer.
Press to switch to UI mode. In UI mode, you can use the pointer.
You'll enter combat soon. Read about the skills in your toolbar before you proceed.
Press {ALT}, then mouse over the icons in your toolbar to learn what each skill does.
Press , then move the pointer {MO} over the icons in your toolbar to learn what each skill does.
Press , then move the pointer {MO} over the icons in your toolbar to learn what each skill does.
Press {F} to start climbing, then use your movement keys to ascend.
Press to start climbing.
Press to start climbing.
"Our journey to salvation was to begin on the Island of Dawn. Instead it began with destruction." —Elleon
The bridge has collapsed! You'll have to swim.
Advance forward. You must find Elleon!
Advance forward.
Troops from the expedition will fight by your side.
Target the enemy in the center of the screen, then left-click {ML} to attack.
Target the enemy in the center of the screen, then press to attack.
Target the enemy in the center of the screen, then press to attack.

Target the enemy in the center of the screen, then use Fireball to attack.

When the enemy flashes red, a powerful attack is on the way. Press to block.
When the enemy flashes red, a powerful attack is on the way. Press to block.
Attacks launched after the enemy flashes red are very powerful. Right-click {MR} to dodge.
Attacks launched after the enemy flashes red are very powerful. Press to dodge.
Attacks launched after the enemy flashes red are very powerful. Press to dodge.

Destroy the blockade, and advance with your new allies.

Summon a Thrall of Protection + to protect you while using heavy damage spells.

Up to 5 players can ride the airship simultaneously.
Repair destroyed siege weapons by using the [F] key.
To board airships and siege weapons, press the [F] key.
Sides will switch roles on round two. The fastest team to destroy the anchorstone wins.
Destroyed airships will respawn after few minutes.
Turret siege weapons are more powerful than mobile ones.
When you capture resurrection locations, you can choose to resurrect closer to the battle.
You can capture a resurrection location by using the [F] key.
When an airship or siege weapon is destroyed, any player inside will die.
Round two will last exactly as long as round one.
Players' gear changes to exclusive equalized gear upon entry to Corsairs' Stronghold.
Only equipped gear is replaced. Any empty equipment slots when you enter the battleground stay empty.
The more you contribute in the battleground, the more rewards you will receive.
All characters automatically adjust to level 65 in this battleground.
Only defenders can board Castle Airship.
You cannot ride cannons or mounts when you are a suicide bomber.
Gather the bombs around each points to become a suicide bomber.
You can use chat ban function at battlegrounds where you have more than 5 members in your team.
To win, the federation players must locate, gather, and carry kumas rock candy to the loading dock.
Kumas players slow down as their HP drops.
Federation players slow down and are unable to use skills while carrying rock candy.
Beware: Some kumas skills have a chance of resetting their cooldown times.
The kumas curse Spanked! cannot be removed.
Federation players must destroy treasure chests to find rock candy.
The treasure chests contain other items besides rock candy.
If a federation player is killed while carrying rock candy, the rock candy goes to the kumas who killed the federation player.
If a kumas player is killed while carrying rock candy, the rock candy is dropped on the ground, and federation players may pick it up.
Some kumas skills have a low-probability chance of resetting their cooldown times.
Only federation team can use chat ban in Kumasylum.
In Fraywind Canyon, you win if you earn more scores than the opponent by seizing pyres.
Neutral monsters will appear at every set time, and beneficial effect for your team will apply on defeating them.
Buff is offered if your team has significantly lower score and less kill number when the score reaches 2,000.
Maximum three allies can seize a pyre.
Use leader exclusive skills to lead the battle to your team's advantage.
You can use chat ban function at battlegrounds where you have more than 5 members in your team.
New consumables show up in your Inventory {I}. Right-click to use.
New consumables show up in your Inventory . Press , , to use.
New consumables show up in your Inventory . Press , , to use.
You've acquired the skill Grim Strike.
You've acquired the skill Pendulum Strike.
You've acquired the skill Whipsaw.
You've acquired the skill Sundering Strike.
You've acquired the skill Cable Step.
You've acquired the skill Death Spiral.
You've acquired the skill Shadow Burst.
You've acquired the skill Smite.
Automatically added to Skills window [K]. Drag to your shortcuts by using your mouse.
Use Retaliate to jump up and attack the basilisk.
You're low on HP. Use Whipsaw.
Use Cable Step on the wooden fence. Cable Step throws your scythes up to 18 meters.
